wiki.title: AVL Encyclopedia
wiki.conceptDesc:
An AVL tree maintains a strict **Balance Factor (BF)**. For any node `n`:

- `H(L)`: Height of the left subtree
- `H(R)`: Height of the right subtree
- **Formula:** `BF(n) = H(L) - H(R)`

**Rule:** A node is balanced if `|BF(n)| â‰¤ 1`. If `|BF| > 1`, a rotation is mandatory.
wiki.bfRule:
When `|BF| > 1`, the tree is skewed:
- **BF > 1**: Left-heavy.
- **BF < -1**: Right-heavy.
wiki.deletionDesc:
Deletion is more complex as it can trigger multiple imbalances up the path:
- **Case A (Leaf)**: Simple removal.
- **Case B (One child)**: Replace with child.
- **Case C (Two children)**: Replace with **Inorder Successor**.

*Note: After deletion, you must check balance on all ancestors up to the root.*
wiki.caseLLDesc:
**Condition:** BF=2, Left Child BF â‰¥ 0.
**Note:** During deletion, child BF can be 0. Rotate right anyway.
**Fix:** Perform a single **[Right Rotation]** on the pivot.
wiki.caseRRDesc:
**Condition:** BF=-2, Right Child BF â‰¤ 0.
**Note:** During deletion, child BF can be 0. Rotate left anyway.
**Fix:** Perform a single **[Left Rotation]** on the pivot.
wiki.caseLRDesc:
**Condition:** BF=2, Left Child BF = -1.
**Fix:** **[Left Rotate]** child, then **[Right Rotate]** parent.
wiki.caseRLDesc:
**Condition:** BF=-2, Right Child BF = 1.
**Fix:** **[Right Rotate]** child, then **[Left Rotate]** parent.
